taskGroup.name: Single Sided Reconstruction in Debrief
taskGroup.intro: Before running through this cheat-sheet, you should really have completed the A Debrief walkthrough cheat-sheet, so you know how to configure Debrief and how to load your data. If you haven't completed the Debrief walkthrough, click on Restore Welcome at the top of this window (or select Welcome from the Help menu), navigate to the Tutorials tab, and start the Debrief walkthrough.

task.name: Tidying the ownship track

intro.b: Frequently, before you can start work on producing the red track, you must perform some grooming of the ownship track.

task.onCompletion: In that task, you fixed some jumps in the ownship track, and filled in a period of missing data. You won't need the current plot for the next stage of the tutorial, so you can close it (by clicking in the 'x' in its title tab) - and no, you won't need to save changes.

taskGroup.name: Working with target tracks
taskGroup.intro: Now it's time to start building the target track
taskGroup.onCompletion: You've now learnt how to create and manage target tracks in Debrief.

task.name: Load and groom sensor data
task.intro: Now we've learned about how to groom data by drag and dropping segments we're going to encounter the Grid Editor - a Debrief panel dedicated to editing raw data.
task.onCompletion: We've now got a track with lovely smooth sensor data. Hmm.

task.name: Generating a segment of target track
task.intro: The next step of the analysis process is to produce a valid target track from our tidied data
task.onCompletion: We now have a pair of target track sections.

task.name: Combining sections of target track
task.intro: Next we're going to combine the discrete track segments into a tidy target track ready for subsequent analysis.
task.onCompletion: That's all the skills you need for single sided reconstruction using Debrief. Clearly there's probably now another step to be performed in how you exploit your shiny new track, but that would depend on your analysis objective.
